data.title: Hashmap Collision!
data.statement:
You’ve just been hired at HasheeCorp™, a company developing a custom key-value store engine. But… there’s a catch.

Due to a bug in the hashing algorithm, the engine <<only uses the first letter of each key>> to determine where it should be stored in the hashmap.

As a result, multiple keys that start with the same letter will <<collide>>, and in case of collision, <<the new key overwrites the previous one>>.

Your job is to simulate this broken hashmap and output its final state.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut:
a: ant=12
b: boat=8
z: zebra=42

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
6
ant 1
anchor 2
bat 3
bubble 4
zoom 5
zoo 6
testCases.testOut:
a: anchor=2
b: bubble=4
z: zoo=6

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testOut:
a: alpha=1
b: bravo=2
c: charlie=3
d: delta=4

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testOut:

b: bicycle=7
c: crystal=99
d: dolphin=3

testCases.title: Test 4

apple 10
ant 20
banana 99
boat 12
zebra 7
zipline 8

b: boat=12

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 1000
[[key]] contains only lowercase letters and numbers (no spaces).
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int

loop N read key:word(100) value:int

write hashmap
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] — the number of key-value pairs.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string [[key]] and an integer [[value]] separated by a space.
data.outputDescription:
For each bucket in the final hashmap, output one line in this format:
[[first_letter]]{{:}} [[key]]{{=}}[[value]]

Sort the output by the [[first_letter]] in ascending alphabetical order.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You’ve just been hired at HasheeCorp™, a company developing a custom key-value store engine. But… there’s a catch.

Due to a bug in the hashing algorithm, the engine only uses the first letter of each key to determine where it should be stored in the hashmap.

As a result, multiple keys that start with the same letter will collide, and in case of collision, the new key overwrites the previous one.

Your job is to simulate this broken hashmap and output its final state.
Input
Line 1: An integer N — the number of key-value pairs.
Next N lines: A string key and an integer value separated by a space.
Output
For each bucket in the final hashmap, output one line in this format:
first_letter: key=value

Sort the output by the first_letter in ascending alphabetical order.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000
key contains only lowercase letters and numbers (no spaces).
Example
Input
5
apple 10
ant 12
banana 9
boat 8
zebra 42
Output
a: ant=12
b: boat=8
z: zebra=42
